interventions.response_for_user: Adding 2/2 to 1/4 will result is a fraction that is bigger than 1/4 and hence the result will not equivalent to 1/4. You need to multiply 1/4 with a fraction that has a value of 1 to get a fraction that is equal in value to 1/4.

Subtracting 2/2 to 1/4 will result is a fraction that is bigger than 1/4 and hence the result will not equivalent to 1/4. You need to multiply 1/4 with a fraction that has a value of 1 to get a fraction that is equal in value to 1/4.
You need to multiply 1/4 with a fraction that has a value of 1 to get a fraction that is equal in value to 1/4.

Multiplying any fraction by a fraction whose value is 1 does not change the value of the fraction but the result is different.2/2 or 3/3 or 4/4 = 1 or in other words, the value of a fraction is 1 whose numerator and denominator is the same. If multiplying a number by 1 will result in the same number, multiplying a fraction by 1 will not change the value of the fraction. Multiplying  1/2 and 2/2 will not change the value of the fraction as 2/2 is same as 1.

Let's represent 1/4 and 4/16 visually. If you observe, the part that is shaded represents 1/4 and 4/16 respectively. The shaded part in both circles representing 2 different fractions are the same. Hence the fraction 4/16 which is a result of multiplying 1/4 and 4/4, is not 4 times greater than 1/4. Instead, 4/16 and 1/4 are both of the same value, making these 2 fractions as an equivalent fraction. The value of the fraction 4/4 is 1. Hence, multiplying a fraction by another fraction whose value is 1 will result in an equivalent fraction.

You are right. Multiplying a fraction by another fraction whose value is 1 will result in a fraction which also will have the same value as the original fraction. Let's represent 1/4 and 4/16 visually. If you observe, the part that is shaded represents 1/4 and 4/16 respectively. The shaded part in both circles representing 2 different fractions are the same. Hence the fraction 4/16 which is a result of multiplying 1/4 and 4/4, is not 4 times greater than 1/4. Instead, 4/16 and 1/4 are both of the same value, making these 2 fractions as an equivalent fraction.
